result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Mejdrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 6 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A Mejdrich in court.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - G.
BTC: GUILTY.
$100+cc+DNA, pp $100/mo beg 7-2-15, ftp 6 days RCJ for contempt.
Status conference on June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Mejdrich in court.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State has extended an offer to the Deft.
Deft to attend CCV class on 5-9-15.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No violent contact with the victim, JLM (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Michael A Mejdrich in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Michael A Mejdrich in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
